pages.text: $(#419600)Crock Pot$() is a block that is used to cook a variety of belly-filling dishes from basic foods.$(br)A $(#419600)Crock Pot$() has 4 slots for ingredients, each of which must be filled with a piece of food for it to start cooking. It also has a slot for fuel, which must be filled with fuel that works in furnace.

A cooking attempt's ingredients have to match a recipe. There are many recipes available for the $(#419600)Crock Pot$(). If an attempt fails to match any recipe at all, $(item)Wet Goop$() ends up being the product.$(br)When a recipe is attempted (i.e. the pot starts cooking), the ingredient groups the ingredients fit into are considered. Almost all recipes require some amount of $(l:intro/ingredients)ingredient values$() from certain ingredient groups, but there are a lot of recipes with specific food requirements.

Lots of ingredients fulfill recipe requirements more readily than others (e.g. 1 $(item)Porkchop$() has the same effect on a dish as 2 $(item)Chicken$()). More filling ingredients tend to have greater ingredient values.$(br2)Each recipe has weight, so that a result can be decided when a set of ingredients fits more than one valid recipe. These weights are called recipe $(l:intro/priority)priorities$().
The $(#419600)Crock Pot$() has 3 tiers. Some foods need a higher tier $(#419600)Crock Pot$() to cook.
